title: Track Real-Time Visitors with Firebase and Google Analytics
excerpt: Learn how to use Firebase and Google Analytics to monitor real-time visitor activity on your website.
content:
Firebase and Google Analytics offer powerful tools to analyze visitor activity on your website in real time. This guide explains how to set them up to access instant insights.

1. Create a Firebase Account

To get started, create a Firebase account:

  1. Visit the official Firebase website.
  2. Log in or sign up using your Google email address.
  3. Link your web project to Firebase by following the setup instructions.

Here are some example steps with screenshots:

2. Integrate Firebase Code

Integrate Firebase into your project based on your development method:

  • Via npm: Install Firebase with the command npm install firebase if using a package manager.
  • Directly in HTML: Copy the Firebase code and place it just before the </body> tag in your HTML file.

3. Deploy Your Project

After configuring Firebase, deploy your project on a web hosting platform. Ensure that the files are correctly updated, as some hosts require manual updates.

4. Configure Google Analytics

Once Firebase is set up, configure Google Analytics to monitor visitors:

  1. Go to Google Analytics.
  2. Select your project from the dashboard.
  3. Navigate to the Reports section and click Real-Time to view visitor data.

5. Integration with Google Tag Manager

For advanced and flexible tag management, set up Google Tag Manager. For more information, read the article Setting Up Google Tag Manager with Google Analytics GA4.

Conclusion

By combining Firebase and Google Analytics, you gain real-time insights into visitor activity on your website. These tools help you optimize user experience with reliable and detailed data.
